remarks: The last symbol of a nonempty word concatenated with its first symbol is the first symbol.  (Contributed by AV, 28-Jun-2018.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Oct-2018.)
statement: lswccats1fst $p |- ( ( P e. Word V /\ 1 <_ ( # ` P ) ) -> ( lastS ` ( P concat <" ( P ` 0 ) "> ) ) = ( ( P concat <" ( P ` 0 ) "> ) ` 0 ) ) $.
